name: Mian Zhong
text:
We are very excited to introduce you, openwashdata, a GHE core open science practice. As you may see, ‚Äúdata is the new water‚Äù and there is yet a lack of up-to-date open data practice in the WASH domain. We build openwashdata community to bridge the gap! 

Subscribe to the newsletter: https://buttondown.email/openwashdata

Follow the project on Github: https://github.com/openwashdata

Share openwashdata website: https://openwashdata.org

Our team member is also going to #World Water Week. Connect and talk to us in Stockholm! The openwashdata is funded by Open Research Data Program of the ETH Board.

name: Saloni Vijay
text:
What's the most important skill for a researcher? 

@Saloni, our Ph.D. student, believes it's resourcefulness, especially when research involves fieldwork and is subject to time constraints.
 
Saloni talked about her own experience doing air quality experiments in Malawi. She said, "Imagine bringing all your tools to Malawi and then realizing there's no right stand to mount the monitors. I was super worried. But thanks to @Hope, our research assistant from Malawi, who said, 'Let's make one.' This is just one example of many situations I faced in two months, where being resourceful helped us to gather the necessary data.‚Äù

In pictures: @Hope and @Saloni building a frame with a movable bar.

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text:
Do you want to work on projects with direct impact on society? Global Health Engineering is hiring! Find all available offers here: https://ghe.ethz.ch/work-with-us/open-positions.html

We are looking for students willing to work on the Bachelor‚Äôs and Master‚Äôs Theses, as well as the Semester Projects. Are you a motivated individual who wants to advance the quality of life and work in sub-Saharan Africa and get the hands on experience in Switzerland, Malawi, Kenya or South Africa? Our cross-disciplinary team is looking for mechanical engineering students to work on thermodynamics, waste characterisation, mechanical engineering, and machine vision.

name: Sebastian Loos
text: üåä Exciting times at #WorldWaterWeek in Stockholm! üá∏üá™üåç Engaging discussions, innovative solutions, and impactful connections - all under one roof. Mian and Sebastian are very grateful for the opportunity to join the global conversation on wash and advocate for the #openwashdata community. Let's enhance the collaboration for a more water-secure and sustainable future! üíß #WWWeek

name: Marc Kalina
text: We are pleased to announce that @GHE Senior Scientist @Marc Kalina has been awarded funding from the @SNF under a three-year grant through the Swiss-South African Joint Research Programme. With Prof. @Catherina Schenck of the @university of the western cape, and jointly supported by the South African @national research foundation, Dr. Kalina's team will be investigating illegal dumping in South African Local Municipalities across the country while developing remote sensing tools to identify and characterise waste leakage points. We are excited to be working with @the university of the western cape, and to share the exciting outcomes of this project as they develop. Exciting MSc thesis topics related to this project are already available. Please visit our website for more details.

name: Elizabeth Tilley
text:
[link the post]
https://ethz.ch/en/news-and-events/eth-news/news/2023/09/blog-is-switzerland-spending-its-climate-funds-wisely.html

Through a new bilateral carbon trading pact, Switzerland is poised to fund the construction of thousands of household biogas reactors in Malawi. In a newly published @eth Zukunfstblog, @GHE Senior Scientist @marc kalina reflects on the track record of similar investments, as well as the ethics of burdening countries like Malawi, located on the frontlines of Southern Africa‚Äôs climate change battle, with failed or failing projects which make little impact on the ground.

It was encouraging to see Dr. Kalina's contribution feature on the ETH main page, and for ETH to facilitate a dialogue on this topic. Watch this space for future updates as we continue to push for an ethical and impactful programme for Malawi and the transparent use of Switzerland's climate funds.

name: Lin Boynton
text:
(add images to post)

What's with the pile of punctured #plasticwaste next to @Lin?


In Malawi, empty #pesticide containers are punctured to prevent others from reusing them (e.g. water storage). 

However, highly concentrated residues from pesticide #packaging and the #plastic itself can still leak into water and soils, which poses serious environmental and human health risks.

Unfortunately, this plastic often has nowhere to go.

In the current linear economy, the cost and burden of disposal is generally passed onto the consumer ‚Äì but safe disposal and #recycling systems for plastic waste are underdeveloped and often inaccessible.

What are better ways to manage pesticide packaging #waste?

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text:
As a chair of Global Health Engineering, we not only work on global sanitation and health problems. Our Master student, Dominic W√§lti, investigates and evaluates working conditions of the crew at Entsorgung + Recycling Z√ºrich (ERZ) with the dual purpose of improving these conditions and developing practical technological solutions to reduce physical strain. His research focuses on waste collection sites spread throughout the city of Zurich. It turns out that a recurring problem emerges where waste is not handled properly, according to regulations. As a result, a significant amount of waste ends up being deposited on the ground. This issue requires the workforce to address the unauthorized disposal. The workers bear the responsibility of manually cleaning the collection sites, they take on this demanding task without the aid of specialized tools or equipment.
 
Dominic's cross-disciplinary thesis encompasses systematic assessment of health at work and technical solution development. Ergonomic analysis methodologies are used for the investigation of physical exertion. Risk assessment tools are applied within this context. Dominic spent two weeks with the workers to observe and assess their working routine, as well as interview them to get insightful suggestions for health at work improvement. His final results are the recommendations provided to ERZ.

name: Saloni Vijay

name: Marc Kalina
text: It was our pleasure to host Professor @ catherine sutherland from @ UKZN for a short but productive visit to Zurich this month. During her stay Prof Sutherland delivered a very compelling lecture to our 'International Engineering' course students on 'Development Perspectives from the South'. We were also fortunate to have her spend time in the GHE offices enaging with the students in our group and brainstorming new research pathways. @ghe is looking forward to another year of collaboration and exchane with Prof Sutherland and her team. Thank you for visiting @cathy and see you in Durban!

name: Elizabeth Tilley
text: How do hospitals manage their infectious waste when there is no garbage collection?  @MAVT student @Mos√© Peduzzi is in Cape Maclear, Malawi, working with a local clinic to improve the combustion of their incinerator to ensure the health of the workers and community.

name: Lin Boynton
text:
Who is following the negotiations for the UN Global Plastic Treaty? Our PhD student @Lin Boynton will be at the #UNEP headquarters in Nairobi next week for the third session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee to develop an international legally binding instrument on plastic pollution, including in the marine environment (INC-3). 

Let us know if you'll also be there! 

#INC3 #globalplasticstreaty #plasticpollution #globalhealth #humanhealth #circulareconomy

name: Saloni Vijay
text:
Curious about the daily personal exposure to PM2.5 and Black Carbon emissions in Blantyre? Our bachelor's thesis student, @Valentin Hirsh, has designed a comfortable user-friendly monitoring kit to answer that, which @Saloni Vijay is using in Malawi for her PhD project! Our volunteers in Malawi are excited to wear this innovative kit.
Stay tuned for updates as we delve into the impacts and findings of the project.
#CleanAirMission #MalawiResearch #AirQualityProject

name: Mian Zhong
text: The first edition of data science for openwashdata received more than 200 registrations from 80+ countries around the world. Each week we tune in together for two hours and a half learning time. It is amazing and motivating to see the dedication and persistence. openwashdata also reached 1.8K unique visitors to the website and 5.7K total pageviews. Thanks for everyone making this community grow!

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text: Did you know that Switzerland has the highest innovation index in the world in 2023 according to https://www.wipo.int/global_innovation_index/en/2023? Countries were analyzed across 80 indicators in categories like Knowledge and Technology Outputs or Human Capital and Research. That is where the ETH contributions are hard to be neglected. That is where we compete at the highest level to move the innovation and technological advancement forward, which in turn brings the economic growth. That is also where we encourage cultural values, freedom, tolerance, diversity, education, experimentation, and ambition.

text:

What do you think is the reason for the peak shown in the graph?

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text: We are urgently looking for a student willing to work on image classification for informal dump sites in South Africa! The work should adapt Random Forests or DNNs applied to images from Google Earth. We plan to quantify the total area and number of all dump sites in four South Africa's Municipalities. All the details are available here: https://sirop.org/app/15cd80c0-0bdc-4741-a68d-b2fe8d24e695?_k=wy1yadA05G-27BUc

https://ghe.ethz.ch/ghe-blog-news/2023/12/blog-the-elephants-in-the-room-at-the-negotiations-for-the-global-plastics-treaty.html

name: Marc Kalina
text: Last year Global Health Engineering MSc student Philippe Colbach, worked with Durban organisation Asiye eTafuleni to design and build a custom urine trolley to collect urine from urinals throughout the city. We are pleased to see it on the streets and actively servicing these emerging urban sanitation solutions. We are looking forward to continuing our partnership with Asiye eTafuleni to develop solutions to store and beneficiate collected urine, and to continue to make Central Durban a healthier and more livable space for commuters and informal workers.

name: Elizabeth Tilley
text: Meet the dream team!  Last week in Blantyre, Malawi, we had the chance to meet up with our long time friends and collaborators. From L-R: @Elizabeth Tilley, @Wrixon Mpanang'ombe, @Johnathan Kwangulero, @Hope Chilunga, @Lin Boynton, @Doreen Ndovie, @Sally Changaya

name: Lin Boynton
text:
Did you catch us on TV the other day? @Elizabeth Tilley was the keynote speaker (and shark tank panelist ü¶à) at a think tank event held by @WASTE Advisers Malawi. After the keynote, there were lots of questions from attendees who were shocked about #airquality data from this paper: https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/public-health/articles/10.3389/fpubh.2023.1242726/full. 

The presentations throughout the day revealed similar data and outdated policies for #wastemanagement, which result in serious #environmental and #humanhealth issues. @Global Health Engineering is part of the network of professionals, researchers, and innovators that came together for the event -- a network that will continue to focus on waste management challenges and solutions in Malawi. 

Thanks to the other sponsors and all the attendees who sparked such interesting conversations and ideas! @Billy Bray @Gerald Bowler (To find the correct person: Chibuku Products Ltd, either of the two profiles) @Daniel Dunga (FCCA) @Bernard Masi Bsoc.Sc(Econs),FCCA,CPA,MBA,DipMc,PGC(Proj Fin) @Lin Boynton @Manota Andrew Mphande @Centre for Environmental Policy and Advocacy @Richard Mvula (To find the correct person: Staff Associate in Geology at Malawi University of Science and Technology) @MADALITSO AMOS (To find the correct person to tag: all caps name, studied at University of Malawi)

name: Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
Lab equipment and scientific machinery combined make up the largest contribution of scope 3 emissions at ETH. Scope 3 indirect emissions are a consequence of the activities, occurring from external sources, e.g., disposed of products from suppliers such as the lab plastic.

LEAF initiative of the ETH Sustainability team assesses the actions taken by the groups towards sustainable operation and the scope 3 emission minimization from laboratories and workshops. We, as a group, were happy to take part in the first round of sustainability assessments. Lin Boynton and Jakub Tkaczuk applied for the bronze certificate and received it during the recent GreenLabs certification ceremony.

name: Mian Zhong
text: Proudly announce that, from this year, openwashdata starts partnerships to expand the community interested in open code and data. We are glad to have our first collaborator, @WASHWeb, to address challenges in accessing, using and sharing WASH data effectively through joint efforts. Reach out to our team if your organization is interested in partnering with openwashdata. https://buttondown.email/openwashdata/archive/openwashdata-news-07-partnership/

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text:
Have you been skiing recently? Every year, the ski season gets shorter and shorter. Some resprts have already been decommissioned; others will go soon. So long, skiing! But that's just skiing.

What about the bigger picture? Data on CO2 and CH4 concentration in the atmosphere + yearly temperature increase may answer this question.
Data source for the figure: NASA, NOAA (https://climate.nasa.gov/).

name: Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
üìä Research Data Management in practice üìà 

We
 have 18 students in our "Research Beyond the Lab" class this year. Open
 Science is in the title, but we actively teach Research Data Management
 for a waste-related research project designed and implemented by the 
students. 

In module 4, we introduce our definitions for three 
stages of research data. How do you differentiate between them? How do 
you treat them?

- Stage 1: unprocessed raw data
- Stage 2: processed analysis-ready data
- Stage 3: final data underlying a publication

Slides: https://lnkd.in/dUJ9e5Ea

name: Elizabeth Tilley
text: üìï"Too rarely discussed is the fact that the necessary starting point of this reporting journey involves the strategic use of estimations and approximations in lieu of exact data"  Here at GHE we love exact dataü§ì.  And that's why @Till Ha√ºsser and @Mario Loeliger are investigating ways to reliably measure methane emissions from biogas burningüî•.  From small projects to sector-wide reform! üöÄ

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text: Open research needs reproducibility and it should include hardware design! Our next action towards reproducible scientific and engineering work is publishing hardware designs openly, under permissive license. The first completed case is the work of @Timo Stutz's on HDPE pre-cleaning system design, manufacturing, and testing, all available on Github (https://github.com/Global-Health-Engineering/pre-cleaning-system-design-for-HDPE-bottles). This repository was certified by the Open Source Hardware Association (https://certification.oshwa.org/ch000021.html) and establishes a workflow we will continue to maintain and promote in the future.

name: Mian Zhong
text: Open data is at the heart of GHE research practice. Check out this newly released data package led by current Ph.D. student @Saloni on source apportionment of light-absorbing carbonaceous aerosols (LAC) in Blantyre, Malawi. These original reproducible datasets offer insights about local pollution from several sources including vehicles, cooking from solid biofuels, and waste burning. Collaboration with wonderful @Hope Kelvin Chilunga @Lennox Khonje @Jack Kamjombo @Elizabeth Tilley @Lars Sch√∂bitz.  https://global-health-engineering.github.io/bcsa/

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text:
February 2024 was the warmest February on record with a global surface air temperature 1.77¬∞C above the 1850-1900 pre-industrial average. January 2024 was the warmest January on record, along with every single month since June of 2023. The previous months are consequently surpassing the 1.5 ¬∞C goal of the Paris Agreement. Switzerland has committed to halving its greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and reaching net zero by 2050, partly through emission offsetting in other countries, with a goal of offsetting over a million tonnes of CO2-equivalent until 2030. Only the relevant technology allows for emission offsetting and only the relevant technology allows for accurate emission estimation.

Currenlty, five of our students develop solutions to reliably and inexpensively estimate the emissions offset by the biogas reactors and improved cookstoves, both interesting and important for the Swiss policy makers.

Thank you @Louis Ambuehl, @Till Haeussner, @Mario Loeliger, @Gian Teufen, and @Michele Strzelecki.

name: Lin Boynton
text:
Plastic is not cheap! 

An estimated USD 300-600 billion per year is associated with the social and environmental costs of plastic pollution:
üìà USD 61 ‚Äì 121 billion per year from carbon dioxide emissions
üêü USD 70 ‚Äì 144 billion per year from impacts to marine ecosystem services
üåä USD 1 billion per year for ocean cleanup
‚öó USD 131 billion per year from exposure to hazardous chemicals
‚òÅ USD 31 ‚Äì 63 billion per year from air pollution

Moreover, these costs disproportionately burden low- and middle-income countries and small island developing states. 

Read more in the #UNEP report ‚ÄúTurning off the Tap‚Äùüö∞ to understand the importance of the negotiations for the #GlobalPlasticsTreaty concluding at the end of this year and the transformation to a #circulareconomy for #plastic. 

https://www.unep.org/resources/turning-off-tap-end-plastic-pollution-create-circular-economy

name: Saloni Vijay
Jan Freihardt
text:
This week, our PostDoc Jan Freihardt visited four of the 36 villages in Bangladesh üáßüá© in which he has been conducting a large-scale panel study on environmental #migration and #climateadaptation over the past 4 years. 
For the first time, he witnessed the situation in the villages during the yearly monsoon flooding üåä  - and was deeply touched by how challenging moving around becomes when roads üõ§Ô∏è and even houses üè† are underwater. Flooded tube wells üö∞, latrines, and cooking stoves ‚ô®Ô∏è greatly complicate daily life. 
At the same time, he was impressed by the resilience üí™ of the communities which have developed various strategies to cope with the yearly recurring floods. 
More info on the study: https://www.research-collection.ethz.ch/handle/20.500.11850/646402

text: Where are the pumps  , waste skips  , and humanitarian organizations  ? Check out part 3/3 of our blog post series by Mian Zhong who teaches you how to use R and open data to create maps. Find out more: https://openwashdata.org/pages/blog/posts/2024-03-01-create-map-part-3/

name: Jan Freihardt
text:
One of the most touching ‚ù§Ô∏è moments during the closing workshop of our research project "Climate risk, land loss, and migration: Evidence from a Quasi-Experiment in Bangladesh" üáßüá© was when one of our study participants shared the story of her family who had repeatedly lost their house üè† and land due to riverbank erosion and a lack of government support. With her story, she challenged the high-level representatives of international and government organizations who had previously presented their strategies for climate change adaptation in Bangladesh. 
This situation vividly illustrates the gap that we frequently experience between what governmental and international organizations plan, and what the communities on the ground would actually want or need. If we are serious about effective climate change adaptation, we urgently need to close this gap. 
What are your experiences? Have you witnessed a similar misalignment between community needs and government plans in other settings? 
#climatechange #adaptation #resilience #Bangladesh
alt_text: Elizabeth Tilley ready for your review!

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text:
Excited to share our newly published policy brief on waste management for Cape Maclear, Malawi! üåç‚ôªÔ∏è
This work, based on five Master's theses, aims to improve public health, environmental conditions, and economic opportunities in Cape Maclear.
Read the full brief: https://doi.org/10.3929/ethz-b-000695292
#WasteManagement #SustainableDevelopment #GlobalHealth #Malawi #ETHZurich
published_link:
Last week, our Bio-Safety Officer Jakub Tkaczuk attended "Curriculum Biosafety" (https://www.sanu.ch/event/bso-biosafety-level-2-bsl2c-course-for-biosafety-officers-bso-1712/) for level 2 laboratories, a comprehensive three-day program that has enhanced our ability to work safely and efficiently, in compliance with the Containment Ordinance and Federal laws. This intensive course covered crucial aspects of biosafety, e.g., lab waste management, safe handling of biorisks and containment principles, risk assessment and management strategies; proper procedures for packing, transporting, and handling biological agents. We're committed to creating a secure environment for our team and the broader community we serve.
#Biosafety #LaboratorySafety #ContinuousLearning

name: Saloni Vijay
text:

name: Natalie Alice Boyd Williams
text: Last week, üåç‚ú® as part of our International Engineering: From Hubris to Hope MSc course at ETH Zurich, we took our learning beyond the classroom to the Swiss National Museum (Landesmuseum) üèõÔ∏è. name: Jan Freihardt
text:
Last week, our GHE postdoc @Jan Freihardt co-facilitated a workshop on ‚ÄúTransforming our university teaching towards sustainability‚Äù together with @WWF Switzerland, @Swiss Young Academy and @Sustainable Development Solutions Network Switzerland SDSN.

The goal of the workshop was to help young lecturers üë©‚Äçüè´ expand their knowledge on the transformative potential of universities and how this change can be initiated internally within universities. Organized by various stakeholders active in academia, the workshop provided essential basic knowledge, teaching strategies, and support offers to incorporate sustainable development üåø into teaching.

You can find the input slides and some materials from the workshops here: https://www.he-sustainability.ch/workshop2024.

During his stay, he will write his #ETH4D PhD proposal, focusing on how remote sensing can be leveraged to detect burning waste sites and their emissions. Hope holds a Master in ü§ñ and Artificial Intelligence, is a lecturer at @MUBAS and runs his own drone company in Malawi üá≤üáº.

Make sure to catch him while he's here to share his insights on the latest advancements in drone technology or to discuss future collaborations! ü§ù

name: Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
Join us on üìÖ Thursday 21. November 2024, 17.15 for a talk by Lars Sch√∂bitz on Data Stewardship. He will highlight the challenges of a modern academic, and our internal and external approach to achieve hashtag#FAIR data sharing practices.

Register for in-person event: https://lnkd.in/eZwBjkqd

üìç ETH Zurich, Campus Zentrum (MM C 78.1 ‚Äì Alumni Pavillon)

üíª Live online: https://lnkd.in/dnFN9YAN

name: Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
"What does the day-to-day life of a data steward in a research group look like?" One of the many excellent questions Lars Sch√∂bitz received
 after his talk on Thursday. Answers will be available as a recording 
soon. In the meantime, you can view his slides here: https://lnkd.in/dNitqvMY

üí• Spoiler üí• His 10 learnings from 3 years:

#1 Technology is not on our side
#2 ETH wants reproducibility
#3 Data management is project management
#4 Predictability wins
#5 Low IT affinity is not a lack of aptitude
#6 Data != Data
#7 Data management is a process, not a checkbox
#8 Findable: Publish for humans and computers
#9: 9 to 5 is possible
#10 Funding for Open Research Data exists

hashtag#openscience hashtag#openresearchdata hashtag#datastewardship

name: Natalie Alice Boyd Williams
text:
üåç‚ú® Updates from #COP29! With the latest developments on Article 6.4, we were happy to dive into the insightful briefing note by Dr. Chipo Mukonza and Dr. Samir Thapa from @MECS programme Loughborough. Their focus on integrating energy justice into carbon projects is crucial. 

Key questions to ponder in carbon offsetting:

1. How are burdens and benefits being distributed? ‚öñÔ∏è
2. Are marginalized groups recognised and includedin decision-making and project design? üó≥Ô∏è
Let's ensure carbon projects are just and inclusive! üíö #Sustainability #EnergyJustice #CarbonOffsetting #ClimateAction

What are your thoughts on these developments? ü§îüí¨

name: Yash Dubey
text:
üìä What would you create if given the challenge to turn raw data into compelling stories?

Last week, openwashdata at GHE hosted an exciting hackathon, challenging data enthusiasts to dive into one of our 30+ datasets and craft innovative visualizations‚Äîand the results were absolutely inspiring! üéâ

üåü A huge congratulations to our winner, @winner_name! Their visualization blew us away with its creativity, clarity, and ability to tell a powerful story with data. Check out their incredible work here: [link].

üëè Shoutout to @second_place and @third_place for their prize-winning contributions as well! Your efforts truly showcased the potential of data visualization to inform and inspire.

This event reaffirmed our belief in the power of open data to drive innovation and collaboration. If you‚Äôre curious to learn more about openwashdata or explore partnership opportunities, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to connect! üöÄ

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text: Master student Teymour D'Andrea is working to build better, cheaper, stronger toilets in South Africa with @Antoinette van der Merwe and the NGO @Nova Institute NPC.  We are grateful to funding from @ETH4D.

name: Nicolas Seemann-Ricard
text: Elia Weber has been developing and testing low-cost flow sensors with different gas mixtures. His custom-built setup in the wet lab fume hood uses mass-flow controllers, humidifiers and heaters to carefully control the test parameters.

name: Nicolas Seemann-Ricard
text: Timon Mettler's data acquisition and transmission device, which focuses on being low-cost and low-power, was built in the mechanical and electronic workshop. The wet lab‚Äôs electronic test-bench helped to find which elements used most power.

name: Nicolas Seemann-Ricard
text: Lorenzo Lafranchi is testing recycled plastic properties, and uses our SLA printer to quickly prototype injection molds (bottom). Here he is checking a mould for a gas sensor housing channel before testing and injection in the mechanical workshop.

name: Nicolas Seemann-Ricard
text: Ylva Peter is designing a low-cost, robust liquid flow rate measurement device aimed at better understanding biogas digesters‚Äô performance. She can prototype quickly with different materials thanks to our laser printer!

name: Yash Dubey
text:
üöÄ New R Data Package Published: WHO's Health Glossary Now Easily Accessible! (https://openwashdata.github.io/glossarywho/)

Health data can be complex, but clear definitions make all the difference. The openwashdata team recently published a structured WHO glossary as an R package, making it easier for researchers, policymakers, and analysts to reference key health terms directly in their workflow.

üîç What‚Äôs inside?
‚úÖ A clean, structured dataset of WHO definitions
‚úÖ Ready for analysis, visualization, and integration into reports
‚úÖ Easy-to-use website, categorised by thematic areas in the WHO report: 
‚úÖ Open-access for everyone!

If you're working with health data and want to standardize terminology effortlessly, check it out! Let‚Äôs make publishing more transparent.

How do you handle consistent terminology in your work?

name: Saloni Vijay
text:

Our field team meeting marked the start of our study on burden of chronic respiratory symptoms and air pollution exposure among waste pickers in Blantyre, Malawi. Led by PhD student @Saloni Vijay, the project officially kicked off last Sunday! 

üë• Team in photo (left to right): @Chana Khuluza, @Juniah Mzeze, @Dunia Wasili, Anstead Kankwatira, @Hope Chilunga, Rose Malamba, Elizabeth Jalisi, @Saloni Vijay, Ramsey Mauka, Innocent Matchipisa.

#AirPollution üåç #LungHealth ü´Å #FieldWork

name: Saloni Vijay
text:
üìù Training for a Successful Survey! [Update 2/4]

A well-prepared team = a successful survey! ‚òÄÔ∏è Here‚Äôs our questionnaire team gearing up for fieldwork for our study on Burden of Chronic Respiratory Symptoms & Air Pollution Exposures Among Waste Pickers. @Saloni Vijay led a briefing, ensuring clarity & accuracy, while the team reviewed translations ‚Äî all while soaking up some sun & vitamin D! ‚òÄÔ∏èüí™  After training, we took the questionnaire to the field for a pilot study to refine questions. üèïÔ∏è 

üíª Behind the scenes, a big thanks to @Colin Walder in üá®üá≠ for refining the questionnaire coding!

@Chana Khuluza, @Juniah Mzeze, @Dunia Wasili, @Ramsey Mauka

name: Saloni Vijay
Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
üöÄ Exciting Opportunity: Scientific Assistant - Data Science / Software Engineer at ETH Z√ºrich! üß™üíª

Are you passionate about #OpenScience and #DataScience? Join our team at the Global Health Engineering group (@D-MAVT) at @ETH Z√ºrich! We're looking for a talented individual to support our two ongoing projects funded by the Open Research Data Program of the ETH Board: (1) openwashdata community and (2) FAIR Data Practices for Qualitative Research in Transdisciplinarity.

https://jobs.ethz.ch/job/view/JOPG_ethz_JdKElDackUdCjqVlFG

üîç What we're looking for:

- Proficiency in Git, GitHub, R, Python, RStudio IDE, VS Code
- Expertise in R Tidyverse packages
- Interest in use of Large Language Models (LLMs) in academia
- Innovative thinker with a knack for process improvement
- Early career professional seeking academic project experience

üåç About us:

We're a diverse, interdisciplinary team of 15 dedicated professionals working on resource-constrained countries. We value openness, creativity, and continuous improvement.

name: Anna Bossard
text:
Exciting news from Mzuzu, Malawi! üá≤üáº With support of BASEflow Limited, we started the construction of a novel biogas plant that is fuelled by human waste üí©

-üí° Based on GHE research, ways to safely treat the effluent from the biogas plant will be tested and optimized over the next 5 years under real conditions.
 -üåø Safely treated effluent contains valuable nutrients and can be used in agriculture as organic fertilizer 
- ü§ù This living lab space allows us to closely interact with different stakeholders such as municipalities, farmers, and local business owners to co-create knowledge and find out what is needed for the long-term success of such technology.

name: Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
üì¢ Exciting news from the Swiss Reproducibility Network (SwissRN)! üá®üá≠

Did you know SwissRN is dedicated to promoting transparent, reproducible, and robust research practices across Switzerland? They build a network of local nodes across the country.

@ETH Z√ºrich is an institutional member of SwissRN and @Lars is now the local node leader for ETHZ! üéâ

Local nodes are the backbone of SwissRN, driving activities like working groups, journal clubs, training workshops, and more.

üëâ Learn more about SwissRN, its mission, and how to get involved: https://www.swissrn.org/
üëâ Find your local node: https://www.swissrn.org/contents/community/nodes/
üëâ Discover SwissRN's institutional members: https://www.swissrn.org/contents/community/organisation/

Let's work together to strengthen research integrity! ü§ù #SwissRN #Reproducibility #OpenScience #OpenResearchData

name: Jan Freihardt
text:
üåç New Blog Post: "Teaching in Ghana - Confronting Privilege and Power in Global Academia" üåç

@Jan Freihardt's new blogpost reflects on a teaching experience in Ghana üá¨üá≠, during which he was confronted with uncomfortable questions about historical inequalities, resource extraction, and the role of privileged academics in North-South collaborations. 
We are curious: Have you experienced similar dynamics in North-South teaching or research settings? What approaches have helped you to ethically navigate such spaces, to foster more ethical and truly reciprocal knowledge exchanges? 

Read the post here: https://ghe.ethz.ch/ghe-blog-news/2025/03/blog-teaching-in-ghana-confronting-privilege-and-power-in-global-academia.html

To further promote accessibility and innovation, we strongly encourage our mechanical engineering students to apply CC-BY licenses to their theses. ‚úÖ Doing so empowers others to build upon your work, fostering collaboration and driving progress in health engineering worldwide. üåç

name: Nicolo Massari
text:
üîí ùóóùó∂ùó± ùòÜùóºùòÇ ùó∏ùóªùóºùòÑ ùüÆùü≥% ùóºùó≥ ùó±ùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùòÇùóΩùóπùóºùóÆùó±ùó≤ùó± ùòÅùóº ùóîùóú ùòÅùóºùóºùóπùòÄ ùó∂ùòÄ ùó∞ùóπùóÆùòÄùòÄùó∂ùó≥ùó∂ùó≤ùó± ùóÆùòÄ ùòÄùó≤ùóªùòÄùó∂ùòÅùó∂ùòÉùó≤?* Keep your research interviews secure with local transcription - introducing ùöêùöëùöé_ùöùùöõùöäùöóùöúùöåùöõùöíùöãùöé, a new Python package developed right here at GHE! üöÄ

This powerful tool streamlines the transcription of audio files while also performing speaker diarization, meaning it identifies and separates who is speaking when. It uses cutting-edge open-source models ‚Äì ùóôùóÆùòÄùòÅùó≤ùóø ùó™ùóµùó∂ùòÄùóΩùó≤ùóø and ùó£ùòÜùóÆùóªùóªùóºùòÅùó≤ ‚Äì to obtain the best possible results.

Crucially, ùöêùöëùöé_ùöùùöõùöäùöóùöúùöåùöõùöíùöãùöé helps ùóøùó≤ùó∫ùóºùòÉùó≤ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóøùó∂ùòÄùó∏ ùóºùó≥ ùóπùó≤ùóÆùó∏ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó∞ùóºùóªùó≥ùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅùó∂ùóÆùóπ ùó∂ùóªùó≥ùóºùóøùó∫ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùòÅùóº ùòÅùóµùó∂ùóøùó± ùóΩùóÆùóøùòÅùó∂ùó≤ùòÄ. üîí You have the flexibility to run it locally on your machine, ensuring your sensitive data stays secure. For those working with larger audio files or wanting to avoid slowing down their local computer, we've also provided clear instructions to run it directly on the ùóòùòÇùóπùó≤ùóø ùó∞ùóπùòÇùòÄùòÅùó≤ùóø, which is open to all ETH members. üíª

ùó™ùóµùòÜ ùó∞ùóµùóºùóºùòÄùó≤ ùöêùöëùöé_ùöùùöõùöäùöóùöúùöåùöõùöíùöãùöé ùóÆùòÅ ùóòùóßùóõ? ü§î Because we're actively collaborating with IT services here to bring you an even more seamless experience! We're working towards providing a fast, one-click access to the tool directly from your browser window on Euler's JupyterHUB instance ‚Äì ùóªùóº ùó∂ùóªùòÄùòÅùóÆùóπùóπùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùóøùó≤ùóæùòÇùó∂ùóøùó≤ùó±! ü§Ø

But that's not all! ‚ú® ùöêùöëùöé_ùöùùöõùöäùöóùöúùöåùöõùöíùöãùöé has been specifically designed with ùóôùóîùóúùó• ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùó£ùóøùóÆùó∞ùòÅùó∂ùó∞ùó≤ùòÄ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùó§ùòÇùóÆùóπùó∂ùòÅùóÆùòÅùó∂ùòÉùó≤ ùó•ùó≤ùòÄùó≤ùóÆùóøùó∞ùóµ ùó∂ùóª ùóßùóøùóÆùóªùòÄùó±ùó∂ùòÄùó∞ùó∂ùóΩùóπùó∂ùóªùóÆùóøùó∂ùòÅùòÜ in mind, aligning perfectly with the goals of the FAIRqual project. üí™ We believe in making research data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable, and this package is a significant step towards achieving that for qualitative data in collaborative, transdisciplinary settings.

A big thank you to @Ariane Wenger and @Anne-Sophie Schaltegger at TdLab for their valuable early-stage feedback! üôè

Stay tuned for more updates on the one-click browser access! üëÄ

Ready to try ùöêùöëùöé_ùöùùöõùöäùöóùöúùöåùöõùöíùöãùöé? Check out the GitHub repository for installation instructions and usage examples: https://github.com/Global-Health-Engineering/ghe_transcribe

We're excited to see how you use ùöêùöëùöé_ùöùùöõùöäùöóùöúùöåùöõùöíùöãùöé to advance your research and promote secure, open, and FAIR data practices! üôå

(*) ‚Äú27% of data uploaded to AI tools is classified as sensitive‚Äù
Source: Cyberhaven‚Äôs 2024 ‚ÄúAI Adoption and Risk Report‚Äù found that 27.4% of data submitted to AI tools by employees was sensitive, up from 10.7% the previous year-a 156% increase.
https://www.cyberhaven.com/blog/shadow-ai-how-employees-are-leading-the-charge-in-ai-adoption-and-putting-company-data-at-risk
https://www.scworld.com/news/shadow-ai-on-the-rise-sensitive-data-input-by-workers-up-156

name: Nicolas Seemann-Ricard
text:
‚ôªÔ∏è Procrastinating your trip to the recycling point? A new planning workflow combines GIS and MILP to improve access to Sammelstellen in Zurich and beyond.
Environmental Sciences Master‚Äôs thesis student @Silas Schweizer developed an urban planning workflow combining GIS and Mixed-Integer Linear Programming to improve @Entsorgung + Recycling Zurich‚Äôs glass and metal recycling network.
üîç His analysis focusing on pedestrian access and network constraints recommends 12 new collection points, reducing:
- the number of underserved residents by 9‚Äô000
- average walking time to recycling points by 20 seconds
üëè A great example of using data to improve recycling rates and helping reach emissions reductions targets. 

üñ•Ô∏è Code & data: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15320179
üìñ Publication coming soon!
#Recycling #GIS #UrbanPlanning #ETHZurich #SmartCities #StudentSuccess

name: Colin Walder
text:
How do smallholder farmers in Malawi üá≤üáº use biogas?

Thanks to a consistent supply of nutrient-rich effluent, farmers now planning to plant üåΩ multiple times annually to boost their harvests which is important given that around half of Malawi's population is affected by food insecurity. Moreover, having access to biogas also allows farmers to cook indoors without smoke, eliminating a significant source of air pollution.  Natalie Alice Boyd Williams's research was supported by the ever wonderful Stella Chisenga [ON LINKEDIN], Owen Mtambo [ON LINKEDIN], and Cyrus Lloyd [NO LINKEDIN].

Would you like to learn more about Natalie Alice Boyd Williams research? https://ghe.ethz.ch/about/people/person-detail.MzM0NzQy.TGlzdC80MTI2LC0xNDYwMDMwNTU3.html

name: Jakub Tkaczuk
text: ü•≥ It was an exciting day at the ZHAW biogas plant in Feldbachüá®üá≠. Our two PhD students: microbiologist Jules Peter and our newest member, Padraic Casserly, who will focus on biogas process engineering, together with Dr. Jakub Tkaczuk, had the opportunity to meet Dr. Wolfgang Merkle to bridge the gap between fundamental and applied research üî¨. Our work will open up valuable knowledge transfer, strengthening our expertise and field experience in sustainable energy research! ‚ö°Ô∏è

name: Colin Walder
text:
Publication alert! üì¢

Our latest article, "Expanding horizons: The pedagogical benefits of museum visits for engineering students", is out now in ETH's Learning and Teaching Journal. 

Lukas Walker, Colin Walder and Elizabeth Tilley highlight how project-based learning can bolster engineering education. üë∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüí° As part of the course "International Engineering: From Hubris to Hope", students visited and reflected on an exhibition on colonialism and looted art üèõÔ∏è, bridging the gap between technical knowledge and the complex real-world contexts engineers must navigate in their careers. üåç

Link to the paper (open access): https://doi.org/10.16906/lt-eth.v5i1.258

Want do learn more about the course which will be offered again in HS 2025? Click here! https://www.vorlesungen.ethz.ch/Vorlesungsverzeichnis/lerneinheit.view?lang=en&semkez=2024W&ansicht=KATALOGDATEN&lerneinheitId=183181&

name: Lars Sch√∂bitz
text:
üåü GHE Yearly 2025: Third Edition at Kloster Fischingen üåü

It's time for our GHE Yearly this week! In our third edition, we've grown from to a team of 10 people in 2024 to a team of 17 people in 2025. Over the next three days, we'll be sharing updates and connecting at the beautiful Kloster Fischingen.

Follow along with our agenda:

üìÖ Day 1: Team Updates & Collaboration

- üìä GHE statistics: Student supervision, OpenWashData, LinkedIn, and ETH Research Collection
- üéì PhD research showcases
- üé® Crafting workshop

üöÄ Day 2: Vision, Strategy & Team Building

- üå† Vision for GHE: Inspiring outlook for the future
- üß≠ Theory of Change Workshop: How do we get where we want to be?
- üîç What Works, What Doesn‚Äôt?: Honest reflections and forward planning
- üíª Website Content Sprint: Refreshing our digital presence together
- üè∏ Badminton Tournament: Friendly competition in our favourite team sport

üå≥ Day 3: Taxonomy, Goal Setting & Nature

- üóÇÔ∏è Taxonomy Workshops: Focusing on structure and clarity
- üéØ Goal Setting for Next Year: Aligning on priorities and ambitions
- üìù Retreat Wrap-Up: Reflections and next steps
- ü•æ Hike Around Fischingen: Closing with a scenic hike

@tag (everyone): Looking forward to an inspiring and productive retreat together! Let‚Äôs make this our best GHE Yearly yet!
